main event: In November 1957, a bright light was observed in St. Albans, West Virginia, coming down and appearing stationary for a while before going straight up. Another report mentioned a brilliant bright object seen moving southwest and disappearing behind a cloud.
interesting points: The duration of the observation was 10-15 minutes.
The conclusion of the first report suggested that the phenomenon was possibly astronomical with insufficient data for evaluation.
The second report concluded that the sighting was caused by a meteor, a balloon, probably an aircraft, or a possible meteor.
No photographs were included in the report.
The sighting involved one or more bright objects moving in unusual patterns and directions.
